react-use-reactive is a custom React hook that allows you to create reactive objects using useState. It supports deep reactivity and updates, even for nested objects.
is a custom React hook that allows you to create reactive objects using useState. It supports deep reactivity and updates, even for nested objects.
To install the react-use-reactive hook, run the following command in your project directory:
Next, use the useReactive hook in your functional components:
This allows for nested objects to also become reactive, instead of a non-reactive object being assigned to a reactive property.
Contributions are welcome! If you find a bug or have a feature request, please open an issue on
. If you'd like to contribute code, please fork the repository and make a pull request.

html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}

@wypratama/react-qr is a React component library for scanning QR codes using the device's camera. This library leverages the jsQR library to decode QR codes and provides an easy-to-use React component for embedding a QR code reader into your application.

is a React component library for scanning QR codes using the device's camera. This library leverages the jsQR library to decode QR codes and provides an easy-to-use React component for embedding a QR code reader into your application.
Import the QRReader component from the library and it's style, and use it in your React component:
Callback function that will be called with the decoded data when a QR code is scanned.
Delay (in ms) between each scan attempt. A value of 0 will scan as fast as possible.
Width of the QR reader component. Use any valid CSS value (e.g., '100%', '400px').
Optional custom styles to apply to the QR reader component.
Optional children to render inside the QR reader component.
, the QR reader will render children inside a default frame. If set to
You can pass custom children and set useFrame to false if you want to customize the appearance of the QR reader:
